root.title: Cher-Charyk (е-69)
root.place: Found in Cher-Charyk district on left (?) coast of the up-river Kemchik.
root.store: Kon delivered to the Minusinsk museum in 1903. Inv. # None.
root.general: The stele is made of gray sandstone. Almost quadrangular in section. Faces are very good processed.
root.description: The inscription consists of 4 vertical lines on one side. There is an almost closed circle and traces of some graphemes on the neighboring side. The inscription on this side couldn't be recovered.
root.size: Height - 88 cm, length - 14 cm, width - 12 cm
root.investigation: Kon found in 1902. Nasilov examined in 1962 587.

pdf.f_title: Памятники тюркской рунической письменности азиатского ареала.

refs.ref: Батманов И.А., Кунаа А.Ч. Памятники древнетюркской письменности Тувы, вып. II. Кызыл, 1963. - С.40-41
